qas.question: From what centuries are the earliest passwords and rituals of Freemasonry known?
What is the oldest Masonic lodge in the world?

answers.text: Lodge of Edinburgh (Mary's Chapel) No. 1 in Scotland

qas.question: What were members who did not practice the physical craft known as?
When compared, how similar are the rituals and passwords from the turn of the 17 - 18 centuries to the ones from the later 18th century?
What is the oldest Masonic Lodge in the world?

answers.text: the Lodge of Edinburgh (Mary's Chapel) No. 1

qas.question: When was the Lodge of Edinburgh started?
When did rituals become similar between different Masonic Lodges?
What century is the only one with passwords and rituals of Freemasonry known?

plausible_answers.text: Lodge of Edinburgh (Mary's Chapel) No. 1 in Scotland

qas.question: What is the only Masonic lodge in the world?
What were members who practiced the magical craft known as?
When was the Lodge of Edinburgh abandoned?
When did rituals become identical between different Masonic Lodges?

context: There is no clear mechanism by which these local trade organisations became today's Masonic Lodges, but the earliest rituals and passwords known, from operative lodges around the turn of the <a0_0><b7_0>17th<b7_0/>–18th<a0_0/> centuries, <a3_0>show continuity<a3_0/> with the rituals developed <a6_0><b11_0>in the later 18th century<b11_0/><a6_0/> by <a2_0><b9_0>accepted or speculative Masons<b9_0/><a2_0/>, as those members who did not practice the physical craft came to be known. The minutes of <a4_0>the <a1_0><b8_0>Lodge of Edinburgh (Mary's Chapel) No. 1<a4_0/> in Scotland<b8_0/><a1_0/> show a continuity from an operative lodge in <a5_0><b10_0>1598<b10_0/><a5_0/> to a modern speculative Lodge. It is reputed to be the oldest Masonic Lodge in the world.
